Hobi Otomotif Sofyan Basir Divonis Bebas dari Kasus Korupsi
05 Nov 2019, 09:38 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Mantan Direktur Utama Perusahaan Listrik Negara (PLN) Sofyan Basir yang diputus bebas pada Senin (4/11). (Foto: CNN Indonesia/Safir Makki)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Mantan Direktur Utama Perusahaan Listrik Negara (PLN) Sofyan Basir yang diputus bebas pada Senin (4/11) dalam jerat kasus korupsi punya hobi otomotif yang lumayan 'mahal'. Berdasarkan Laporan Harta Kekayaan Penyelenggara Negara (LHKPN), Sofyan menyimpan Toyota Avanza sampai Land Rover.Mengutip LHKPN atas nama Sofyan Juli 2018 -untuk pelaporan periodik 2017, ia memiliki aset lima unit mobil yang nilainya ditaksir mencapai Rp6.330.596.000.Mobil itu antaranya Toyota Alphard 2013 senilai Rp1,015 miliar, kemudian Avanza tahun produksi 2014 dengan taksiran Rp115.596.000, serta sedan Honda Civic 2016 senilai Rp400 juta. Dua mobil Sofyan lain yaitu BMW 2016 nilai taksiran Rp1,8 miliar dan mobil asal Inggris Land Rover tahun produksi 2014 Rp3 miliar. Sofyan Basir juga pernah punya mobil lain namun statusnya sudah perindah tangan alias dijual.Sementara itu dalam laporan LHKPN pada November 2016, ia sempat punya Mercedes-Benz 2011 Rp1.881 miliar, BMW 2004 nilainya Rp800 juta, Land Rover 2008 Rp2,1 miliar, serta Alphard 2009 Rp1,1 miliar.Masih mengutip LHKPN dalam laporan periode Juli 2018, aset Sofyan paling banyak ada pada giro dan setara kas dengan angka Rp55.876.641.710. Sedangkan total kekayaan Sofyan keseluruhan mencapai Rp119.962.588.941.Jaksa Penuntut Umum Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) pada Senin (7/10) telah menuntut bersalah Sofyan dengan hukuman lima tahun penjara dan denda Rp200 juta. Sofyan didakwa mengetahui rencana pemberian uang kepada Partai Golkar, uang ini berasal dari pengusaha Johannes Kotjo terkait proyek PLTU Riau-1.Anggota DPR dari fraksi Golkar, Eni Maulani Saragih disebut menyampaikan kepada Sofyan bahwa ia ditugaskan Setya Novanto mengawal perusahaan Johannes B Kotjo dalam proyek pembangunan PLTU Riau-1.Sofyan membantah seluruh dakwaan. Sofyan mengatakan PLTU Riau-1 merupakan salah satu proyek kelistrikan guna mewujudkan program listrik 35 ribu megawatt.Saat membacakan pleidoi pada Senin (21/10) lalu, Sofyan masih memohon Majelis Hakim Tipikor untuk membebaskannya dari seluruh tuntutan. Sofyan menganggap Jaksa KPK tak bisa membuktikan seluruh tuntutan. (ryh/mik)

Automotive Hobby Sofyan Basir Sentenced Free of Corruption Cases
05 Nov 2019, 09:38 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Former Managing Director of the State Electricity Company (PLN) Sofyan Basir who was terminated free on Monday (4/11). (Photo: CNN Indonesia / Safir Makki)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Former Managing Director of the State Electricity Company (PLN) Sofyan Basir who was terminated freely on Monday (4/11) in the snare of corruption cases has a fairly 'expensive' automotive hobby. Based on the State Organizer's Wealth Report (LHKPN), Sofyan saves the Toyota Avanza to the Land Rover. Citing the LHKPN on Sofyan's behalf in July 2018 - for periodic reporting in 2017, he has assets of five units of cars whose value is estimated to reach Rp6,330,596,000. The 2013 Toyota Alphard was valued at Rp1,015 billion, then the Avanza of 2014 production with an estimated Rp115,596,000, and the 2016 Honda Civic sedan worth Rp400 million. Two other Sofyan cars, the BMW 2016, estimated value of Rp1.8 billion and the car from the UK Land Rover in 2014 production of Rp3 billion. Sofyan Basir also had another car, but his status has changed hands, or sold. Meanwhile, in the LHKPN report in November 2016, he had a Mercedes-Benz 2011 worth Rp1.881 billion, BMW 2004 worth Rp800 million, Land Rover 2008 Rp2.1 billion, and Alphard 2009 Rp1.1 billion. Still quoting LHKPN in the July 2018 report period, Sofyan's assets are mostly in current accounts and cash equivalents with figures of Rp55,876,641,710. While Sofyan's total wealth totaled Rp119,962,588,941. The Public Prosecutor's Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) on Monday (7/10) has sued Sofyan with five years in prison and a Rp200 million fine. Sofyan was charged with knowing the plan to give money to the Golkar Party, this money came from businessman Johannes Kotjo related to the Riau PLTU project. The Riau-1.Sofyan PLTU has denied all charges. Sofyan said the Riau-1 PLTU was one of the electricity projects to realize the 35 thousand megawatt electricity program. When reading the plea on Monday (10/21), Sofyan still pleaded with the Corruption Court Panel to free him of all demands. Sofyan considers that the KPK prosecutor could not prove all the demands. (ryh / mic)
